analytic.title: On the infeasibility of training neural networks with small squared errors

abstract.p: We demonstrate that the problem of training neural networks with small (average) squared error is computationally intractable. Consider a data set of M points (Xi, Yi), i = 1,2, ... , M, where Xi are input vectors from R d , Yi are real outputs (Yi E R). We will prove for several classes F of neural networks that achieving a relative error smaller than some fixed positive threshold (independent from the size of the data set) is NP-hard.
